campaigns.title: The Shattered Starfall: Rise of the Void Sovereign
campaigns.description: When the constellation of heroes itself falls from the sky in burning fragments, the ancient Void Sovereign imprisoned beneath the world stirs. The PCs must reunite the scattered starlight to reignite the celestial seal before the Sovereign’s umbral armies drown the mortal realm in endless night.
campaigns.setting: The realm of Luminastra, a world split between the Daylands—sun-kissed kingdoms of mortals—and the Veiled Depths, a reversed under-realm where stars shine beneath stone skies. Leylines run like glowing rivers, and great crystal lighthouses called Astral Spires channel starlight that powers cities and wards.
campaigns.theme: Classic high fantasy—hope against overwhelming darkness, heroic legacy, and the power of united hearts
campaigns.starting_location: Starhaven, a cliffside academy-city built around the cracked Astral Spire, now flickering as meteors of fallen star-heroes crash around it
campaigns.main_conflict: The Void Sovereign, sealed millennia ago when seven constellations turned into the first star-heroes, now breaks free as those stars are shattered by a shadow comet. Only by rekindling the seven virtues within new heroes and restoring the constellation can the seal be renewed.
key_npcs: Arch-Commander Seraphiel Dawnbringer, once a constellation made flesh, now mortal and guilt-ridden over his fallen kin
Lady Nyssandra Veilshade, half-elf spy-mistress secretly descended from the Void Sovereign’s lieutenants, torn between blood and duty
Dormant Spark (a tiny living star fragment), childlike yet eons old, who knows hidden paths to each fallen star
Prince Caeleth Brightlance, heir to the Sapphire Throne, desperate to prove himself a hero instead of a figurehead
General Vornak Ironshatter, war-forged veteran leading the Sovereign’s Umbral Legions in relentless moonless assaults
potential_quests: Retrieve the First Shard from the Moonlit Gorge, where starlight wolves guard the fragment of Courage
Negotiate safe passage through the treetop city of Aetherglen, where rebel sky-pirates claim one shard as their own
Descend into the Veiled Depths to rescue the lost Star-Mage whose knowledge can repair the Astral Spire
Defend Starhaven’s last lighthouse crystal against a night-long siege while refugees seek shelter within its walls
Forge the Bonded Oathblade by questing to each kingdom’s sacred forge, uniting rival nations against the coming void

campaigns.title: The Crimson Widow's Veil
campaigns.description: In the shadow-shrouded land of Ravencroft Hollow, a crimson fog rises each night to steal memories and add them to the web of an ancient, unseen entity. The party must untangle a conspiracy of corrupted nobles, shunned scholars, and dead gods while their own pasts fray thread by thread. Every answer found costs a piece of who they were, until only truth—or madness—remains.
campaigns.setting: Ravencroft Hollow: a mist-locked valley where dusk lasts for nine hours and dawn never truly comes. Three decaying towns—Gravesend (port), Witherwatch (university ruins), and Briarhall (noble estates)—circle an obsidian lake said to mirror what viewers have forgotten. Iron lanterns burn blood-oil to keep the fog at bay, and the dead outnumber the living in ledger and on street alike.
campaigns.theme: Gothic horror, unraveling identity, creeping dread
campaigns.starting_location: Gravesend’s Gallowmere Inn, a crooked timber building on stilts above reeking tides. The party awakens in communal rooms with missing personal items, hollow gaps in their memories, and matching crimson handprints on the doors. A single note in each character’s handwriting but none of their memories reads: "Before the Widow drinks us dry, remember the name you lost."
campaigns.main_conflict: The Crimson Widow, a spider-like goddess once imprisoned in dream-webs, is awakening as local rituals feed her stolen memories. Each mind consumed strengthens her veil and erases reality’s stitches. Unless her cult is dismantled and her true name spoken aloud beneath the blood-moon, she will drape the world in silk spun from every forgotten life and become the only thing left remembered.
key_npcs: Lady Seraphina Briarhall—last heir of a dying noble line, secretly hosting the Widow’s voice in her shattered mirror
Professor Aldous Grimwald—disgraced memory scholar exiled from Witherwatch, willing to barter others’ recollections for forbidden lore
The Fogwalker—masked vigilante who stalks streets at dusk, stealing back memories and returning them as twisted dreams
Morwyn Graves—cemetery keeper who speaks with the buried, her price is always a childhood memory she never lived
Silas Voss—cult priest whose gentle demeanor masks a willingness to erase entire bloodlines to complete the Widow’s tapestry
potential_quests: Investigate why portraits in Briarhall’s gallery bleed when viewed, uncovering a lineage replaced by stitched-together imposters
Retrieve a mnemonic relic from Witherwatch’s sealed library while navigating corridors that rewrite themselves and the adventurers’ skill sets
Rescue a child whose memories manifest as living shadows; each rescued memory becomes a future enemy
Infiltrate a masquerade ball where masks feed the wearers stolen identities; unmask the host before dawn or become the masks forever
Follow the Fogwalker into the mirror-realm beneath the obsidian lake to learn the Widow’s true name—spoken only by her own reflection

campaigns.title: Crown of Whispers
campaigns.description: In the twilight kingdom of Obsidia, where shadows carry secrets and daggers bear noble crests, five great houses vie for control over an empty throne. Every alliance masks betrayal, every gift conceals poison, and every promise is written in invisible ink that appears only when blood is spilled. The players must navigate courtly machinations while determining who truly deserves—or can seize—the crown from the grasp of ancient conspiracies.
campaigns.setting: The Kingdom of Obsidia sprawls across a mist-shrouded valley where ancient magic has been harnessed to create "shadow networks"—living shadows that serve as spies and couriers for those who know the secret rituals. Noble houses rule from fortified estates built upon floating islands tethered by chains of light, while commoners dwell in the misty lowlands where rumors spread like plague and changelings walk in borrowed faces. The queen lies mysteriously comatose, her mind locked in the Dreaming Palace that exists between waking and sleep, and the royal regalia has vanished along with the heir apparent.
campaigns.starting_location: The Sapphire Spire, a neutral ground tower where noble houses and their retainers gather for the Grand Conclave—the first council in fifty years to determine the fate of the throne. Each room is warded against scrying, and the wine flows freely as masks slip and old grudges rekindle.
campaigns.main_conflict: The ancient Pact of Five Houses that has maintained Obsidia's peace for centuries has been secretly broken by House Umbral through the creation of shadow-clones that can perfectly impersonate rival nobles. As these doppelgängers infiltrate the highest echelons of power, they prepare to collapse the kingdom into war, allowing House Umbral to emerge as sole rulers while claiming to be the only true defenders against chaos. The shadow-clones must be stopped before they start the Succession War, but exposing them risks revealing every house's darkest secrets.
key_npcs: Lord Cassius Umbral - Master of Shadows who claims to seek peace but commands the whisper-networks and shadow-clones
Lady Seraphine Dawnbreaker - Uncompromising matriarch whose house officially wields light-magic while secretly harboring a blood cult
Marquis Vex Hollow - Charismatic spymaster who sells information to all sides while playing an elaborate game of quadruple-cross
Princess Mira (the Comatose Sovereign) - The sleeping queen who appears in dreams to deliver cryptic warnings that may be traps or truths
Corwin the Fool - The court jester who remembers everyone's secrets but speaks only in riddles and nursery rhymes that conceal assassination orders
potential_quests: Investigate the murder of a second-born son whose death was staged as suicide, uncovering coded messages in his supposed suicide note that reveal the identity of his killer and the next target
Steal the Dagger of Truths from House Umbral's vault—a magical blade that forces those cut by it to speak only truth, but whose theft will certainly spark diplomatic outrage
Sabotage the wedding alliance between House Hollow and House Dawnbreaker by exposing one of the betrothed as a shadow-clone, ideally without revealing which house created the fake
Infiltrate the Dreaming Palace through shared dreaming to discover whether Princess Mira is truly unconscious or if someone has stolen her sleeping mind to manipulate the throne

Navigate the Shadow Tournament where noble houses send champions to compete for the right to speak first at conclave, while determining which competitors are real and which are shadow-clones sent to assassinate rivals

campaigns.title: The Verdant Expanse
campaigns.description: Centuries ago, the continent of Viridia sank beneath the waves, its mystical heartland preserved by powerful druidic magic. Now the mists have finally parted, revealing a pristine wilderness untouched by mortal hands and brimming with the remnannts of a lost civilization whose magic warped both land and life itself.
campaigns.setting: The Verdant Expanse is a newly-emerged continent covered in overgrown ruins, living stone forests, crystalline rivers that flow upward, and floating islands tethered by massive vines. Ancient elven cities lie partially phased between planes, while beast-like descendants of the original inhabitants have evolved into entirely new species. The few humanoid settlements are temporary research outposts and waystations established by distant kingdoms racing to claim territory.
campaigns.theme: Pristine wilderness exploration and discovery of pre-calamity civilization
campaigns.starting_location: Camp Horizon, a hastily-constructed wooden fortress at the continent's only safe harbor, populated by rival explorers, scholars hoping to unlock druidic secrets, and merchants selling supplies at extortionate prices
campaigns.main_conflict: Three major factions race to uncover the Heart-Spring - the continent's magical core - while the ancient druidic defenses begin awakening to expel all intruders, threatening to sink Viridia once more
key_npcs: Quercus Shadeleaf, a treant prophet who remembers the sinking and offers cryptic warnings about disturbing the balance
Professor Elara Brightfeather, gnomish archaeologist whose obsession with ancient magic may unleash horrors best left buried
Captain Grimsby Stonebeard, githyanki privateer who claims salvage rights over any magical artifacts found
Zephyr-Voice, a couatl spirit who tests explorers' worthiness with increasingly dangerous trials
Thane Korvak Ironhide, leader of the Stonefist Expeditionary Force whose brutal efficiency masks a desperate search for a cure to a plague ravaging his homeland
potential_quests: Map the Whispering Woods where trees grow upside-down and gravity works in reverse
Locate the Observatory of Stars - an ancient elven star-mapping tower that predicts the continent's next sinking
Negotiate with the Beastclaw tribes who claim descent from the original inhabitants and guard the path to the Heart-Spring
Recover the Codex of Roots from a library trapped in a time bubble before rival explorers destroy it
Discover why expeditions sent to the Singing Desert have vanished, leaving only musical footprints leading nowhere

campaigns.title: Crimson Skies of the Sapphire Archipelago
campaigns.description: Sail the treacherous Sapphire Archipelago where ghost ships haunt moonlit waters and every coral-crowned island hides forgotten treasures. As the empires wage distant wars, pirate fleets carve kingdoms from sea and sand, bound by blood oaths and black powder.
campaigns.setting: The Sapphire Archipelago—eight hundred scattered islands floating between two warring empires. Crystal-clear lagoons hide leviathan graveyards, while floating fortress-cities made from captured galleons serve as lawless ports. Ancient cyclopean ruins rise from jungle-choked islands, holding pre-sunken civilization secrets.
campaigns.starting_location: Tortuga's Wake—a floating pirate city built from lashed-together ships surrounding a massive sea turtle's shell. Players begin as new crew aboard the Crimson Kraken, a notorious pirate vessel recruiting for a legendary treasure hunt.
campaigns.main_conflict: Captain Blackheart Bloodwake has awakened something ancient beneath the waves—an eldritch kraken that grants him control over wind and wave, but demands ever-increasing sacrifices. As his ghost fleet grows, the free pirates must unite or be dragged into the crushing depths.
key_npcs: Captain Isadora 'Sea Witch' Valdris - Crimson Kraken's captain seeking redemption for past sins
Admiral Thaddeus Ironclad - Naval commander determined to bring order through brutal conquest
First Mate Jalen Fletcher - Mutinous quartermaster with a map tattooed on his back
Madame Coraline - Tavern keeper with a network of informants and a mechanical parrot spy
Tide Speaker Zarola - Mysterious merfolk shaman warning of the approaching Deep Hunger
potential_quests: Race to claim Captain Bloodwake's lost treasure map before rival crews and imperial spies
Investigate disappearing ships near the Siren's Teeth—not to rescue, but to salvage their cargo
Navigate the Maelstrom Maze—a shifting storm where time flows differently and treasure islands appear
Broker an alliance between the Sea Elves and pirate fleets against the common threat
Steal the Imperial Dreadnought 'Invincible' to stop it from bombarding the free ports into submission
